info.title: Axiom Public API
info.description: A public and stable API for interacting with Axiom services

get.description: Get list of datasets available to the current user.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: when saveAsKind is true, this parameter indicates the id of the associated dataset

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique ID of the dataset where you want to send data.

parameters.name: timestamp-field
parameters.description: The name of the field to use as the timestamp. If not specified, the timestamp will be the time the event was received by Axiom.

parameters.name: timestamp-format
parameters.description: The date-time format of the timestamp field. The reference time is `Mon Jan 2 15:04:05 -0700 MST 2006`, as specified in https://pkg.go.dev/time/?tab=doc#Parse

parameters.name: csv-delimiter
parameters.description: The delimiter to use when parsing CSV data. If not specified, the default delimiter is `,`.

parameters.name: X-Axiom-CSV-Fields
parameters.description: A list of optional comma separated fields to use for CSV ingestion. If not specified, the first line of the CSV will be used as the field names.

parameters.name: X-Axiom-Event-Labels
parameters.description: An optional JSON encoded object with additional labels to add to all events in the request

requestBody.description: Data you want to send to Axiom in a supported format.

schema.description: a JSON or ND-JSON array of events to ingest
a JSON or ND-JSON array of events to ingest
a JSON or ND-JSON array of events to ingest

startTime.description:
start and end time for the query, these must be specified as RFC3339 strings
or using relative time expressions (e.g. now-1h, now-1d, now-1w, etc)

variables.description: Variables is an optional set of additional variables that are inserted into the APL

args.description: Args specifies any non-field arguments for the aggregation. Fx. [10] for topk(players, 10).

fields.description:
Fields specifies the names of the fields this aggregation is computed on.
Fx ["players"] for topk(players, 10)

name.description:
Name is the system name of the aggregation, which is the string form of aggregation.Type.
If the aggregation is aliased, the alias is stored in the parent FieldInfo

AggInfo.description: AggInfo captures information about an aggregation

fieldsMetaMap.description: FieldsMetaMap contains the unit information (if we have it) for each field in the given dataset entry

format.description: Format specifies the result set format. Either "legacy" (default) or "tabular".

matches.description: Matches hold the matching events of a filter query in the "legacy" result format

tables.description: Tables hold the result tables in the "tabular" result format

BucketInfo.title: BucketInfo captures information about how a grouped query is sorted into buckets.

field.description: Field specifies the field used to create buckets on. Normally this would be _time.

size.description:
An integer or float representing the fixed bucket size.
When the bucket field is _time this value is in nanoseconds.

BucketInfo.description: The standard mode of operation for Kirby is to create buckets on the _time column,

created.description: The RFC3339-formatted time when the dataset was created.

FieldInfo.title: FieldInfo captures information about a field used in the tabular result format. See Table.

caseSensitive.description: Supported for these filters: starts-with, not-starts-with, ends-with, not-ends-with, contains, not-contains, eq, ne.

children.description: Supported for these filters: and, or, not.

op.description: We also support '==', but we’re not exporting that to swagger, because it can’t deal with it add >, >=, <, <= to that list, it breaks codegen.

GroupInfo.title: GroupInfo captures information about a grouping clause in the tabular result format. See Table.

visible.description:
Where in the frontend should this filter be visible
e.g. ["datasets", "stream", "dashboards"]

parentValue.description:
If this filter has a parentField, then this is the value to match on
if the parentField filter is set

reset.description:
selecting this option would reset the filter
usually for "All", etc first options

fieldsMeta.description: FieldsMeta contains the unit information (if we have it) for each field

resolution.description:
The time resolution of the query’s graph, in seconds. Valid values are
the query’s time range /100 at maximum and /1000 at minimum or "auto".

startTime.description:
start and end time for the query, these must be specified as RFC3339 strings
or using relative time expressions (e.g. now-1h, now-1d, now-1w, etc)

fieldsMeta.description: FieldsMeta contains the unit information (if we have it) for each field

resolution.description:
The time resolution of the query’s graph, in seconds. Valid values are
the query’s time range /100 at maximum and /1000 at minimum or "auto".

startTime.description:
start and end time for the query, these must be specified as RFC3339 strings
or using relative time expressions (e.g. now-1h, now-1d, now-1w, etc)

cursor.description: A cursor for use in pagination. Use the cursor string returned in previous responses to fetch the next or previous page of results.

includeCursor.description: Specifies whether to include the row identified by the `cursor` in the results. Default is false.

limit.description: Specifies the maximum number of events to return. Default is 1000, minimum is 0, maximum is 50000.

resolution.description:
The time resolution of the query’s graph, in seconds. Valid values are
the query’s time range /100 at maximum and /1000 at minimum or "auto".

startTime.description:
start and end time for the query, these must be specified as RFC3339 strings
or using relative time expressions (e.g. now-1h, now-1d, now-1w, etc)

RangeInfo.title: RangeInfo specifies the window a query was restricted to.

end.description:
End is the ending time the query is limited by.
Queries are restricted to the interval [start,end).

field.description: Field specifies the field name on which the query range was restricted. Normally _time

start.description:
Start is the starting time the query is limited by.
Queries are restricted to the interval [start,end).

failed.description: Number of failures that occurred during ingest

failures.description: List of failures that occurred during ingest

fieldsMeta.description: FieldsMeta contains the unit information (if we have it) for each field

format.description: Format specifies the result set format. Either "legacy" (default) or "tabular".

matches.description: Matches hold the matching events of a filter query in the "legacy" result format

tables.description: Tables hold the result tables in the "tabular" result format

SourceInfo.title: SourceInfo specifies the provenance of a results Table.
SourceInfo.description:
Result sources will typically be the names of a datasets that were searched,
but may be expanded to other things in the future.

maxCursor.description:
Row id of the newest row, as seen server side.
May be higher than what the results include if the server scanned more data than included in the results.
Can be used to efficiently resume time-sorted non-aggregating queries (ie filtering only).

minCursor.description:
Row id of the oldest row, as seen server side.
May be lower than what the results include if the server scanned more data than included in the results.
Can be used to efficiently resume time-sorted non-aggregating queries (ie filtering only).

Table.title: Table defines the schema for query results in the "tabular" result format.

columns.description:
Columns contain a series of arrays with the raw result data.
The columns here line up with the fields in the Fields array.

fields.description:
Fields contain information about the fields included in these results.
The order of the fields match up with the order of the data in Columns.

groups.description: Groups specifies which grouping operations has been performed on the results.

name.description: Name is the name assigned to this table. Defaults to "0". The name "_totals" is reserved for system use.

order.description: Order echoes the ordering clauses that was used to sort the results.

sources.description: Sources contain the names of the datasets that contributed data to these results.

Table.description: The tabular result format can be enabled via APLQueryParams.ResultFormat or QueryParams.ResultFormat.

numDeleted.description:
numDeleted has been deprecated on 2022-09-14.
There is currently no way to tell how much was trimmed via the trim result.
If you need to check how much was deleted you can either query the removed time range,
or poll the dataset info endpoint.

ConnectNextStep.description: the next step for an integration

scopes.ChangeAccess: Allow editing of users on this organization, and assigning them permissions
scopes.ChangeApiKeys: Allow creating and disabling API keys
scopes.ChangeAuthentication: Allow creating and updating authentication mechanisms
scopes.ChangeIntegrations: Allow creating and editing of integrations
scopes.ChangeMonitorsAndNotifiers: Allow creating and editing of monitors and notifiers
scopes.ChangeSavedQueries: Allow creating and updating saved queries
scopes.ChangeVirtualFields: Allow creating and editing virtual fields
scopes.ManageBilling: Manage billing, changing pricing tiers, viewing invoices
scopes.ManageDatasets: Allow editing and deleting of datasets
scopes.ManageEndpoints: Manage endpoints, changing endpoints, viewing endpoints for integrations
scopes.ViewMonitorsAndNotifiers: Allow viewing of monitors and notifiers
